title: Congrats!  You just hit 30, and you're ready to play ranked!  Here's some helpful tips.
body:
Don't.  You are still garbage at this game.  Some of you are thinking 'No way I think I'm pretty good.'  You're not.  You are bad.  

You are grossly underestimating the skill floor, knowledge, and game sense that League requires.  Do yourself a favor and play norms.

For a long time.

Because you're still bad.  And likely will be for awhile.

Norms actually do learn you a whole lot of things. And norms have a mmr of their own, it is a good checking of what your skill can get you to. As a mostly norm player, I knew I could easily go into ranked when I was matched consistently with people above my league in norms (checking lolnexus or sthg). And that's why without doing a lot of rankeds at all ( I gotta have 5-10 times more normals than ranked) I got into diamond without much problems.

normal games don't have a competitive environment, then this is subjective in my norms no one gives a fuck about the game 

ranked games will always be superior to teach you the game, this OP is bullshit, i learned by playing ranked games
in season 2 i played 400 or 600 ranked games with like 48% win rate, and i still learned and then climbed and climbed at the end of season 3 i ended up diamond 1

Norms with high ranking MMR probably have a smaller to zero competitive environment because there are no consequences to losing. So you'll probably see people fuck around more (whenever I go into customs with high ranked friends, they usually do builds like AD thresh because they are just trying to have fun). 

In lower elo norms are pretty good for learning and practicing champions against human opponents. Some people fuck around, but it's not always the case.
+1, makes sens
Woohoo!

You can still learn the game in normals.
The example I always use is learning map awareness as Nunu jungle. I see enemy jungler, I take all his camps, place deep wards, and keep my eyes on the map.

Just after like 3 games, my map awareness improved by a ton, and that's all from playing normals.

You'd certainly not learn much if your primary goal is to have fun, but you can still learn in a non-competitive environment if you're trying to learn.

I'll agree ranked games are superior to learning the game, however as someone who's never been in Bronze, I would like to state I spent a long time in normals before playing ranked. Plus, that first game playing ranked and then getting thrashed can tilt someone for a lifetime. 

In the end, it's up to the player whether they want to rank quickly or take their time. Either way seems to work.

Edit:
Actually, thinking about it, I would say Ranked is superior for learning Macro skills or champion matchups (especially against the FOTM ops), but normals are a safe area to practice PVP mechanics with champions you're not familiar with. I wouldn't dare play Zed against another player in ranked, atm.
Normal is good to be used to a champ, then u go in ranked to learn matchup and climb.
Normals are a place to practice champion mechanics, as people won't take macro game seriously in the slightest.

If wanting to get a certain rank is your goal, then you're gonna have a bad time.

Nonsense!

All you need for Ranked is basic understanding of the game alongside 2-3 Full Runepages and 3-4 Champions you don't completely suck with.
At Level 30 you usually had those capeabilitys (since they halved the required EXP for 30 I'm not entirely sure about this right now, but the original statement remains.)

I started Ranked the second I got my 16th Champion. Which took some time because I focused my early IPs on Runes and expensive Champions like Brand because I simply didn't know about the restrictions due to the Pick/Bann system.

So yeah - I started into ranked fast, have seen the Pick/Bann system the first time, had now idea about lane management or w/e and guess what.. I won games! Simply because I had a tiny bit of talent (like hitting Brand Ws!)

Because that's litterally all you'll ever need to win games in at 1200MMR! 
-------------------------------------
I signed up for League mid Season 2 and ended up High Silver at the end of the Season... I wish anyone would have told me I get the gold cup with just 2-3 more wins... q.q x'D

So did it hurt me starting into ranked that fast??? I peaked at Dia 3 in Season 5 despite a lack of time due to study and RL in general! So obviously not!
-------------------------------------

So my iteration:

Congrats! You just hit 30, and you're ready to play ranked! Here's some helpful tips:

- JUST DO IT! It's not so special! Just 9 other guys playing the game just like you do! Don't be scared, but don't expect to much. Play and learn! Watch the more experienced Teammates and if you loose, don't get mad - just look at the game once more and try to figure out what went wrong! That's how you learn the most!

What else do you want?

I jumped into Ranked the second I could. I won games. - what else is important?

That's literally all that counts. At 30 you're supossed to have a skilllevel equaling 1200MMR. Obviously I, and alot of others, had this skill level. So why should I play 500 normals to improve for 100-200 points if I can just jump into rank and make the same progress 50 games in?

No, don't listen to OP. 
Play ranked. Worst case you're landing in Bronze and you get a FREE icon at the end of the season.
Best case if you don't play ranked? You get no icon.

HA, see? PLAY RANKED!

OP is 100% right.

I continued to play normals (draft mode) for months after reaching level 30.  When I finally did play ranked, I placed into Silver 5.  After that I had high enough of a win% that I skipped S4 into S3 and then skipped S2 into S1.  Only in my promos to Gold did I finally not  win in one series.  I did win in my second though.  Within just a couple weeks of playing ranked, I was in Gold.

I attribute that to not playing Ranked until I was ready.  Otherwise I would have had to climb through many more ranks on my way, and had to deal with far worse (bronze) teammates along the way.

I agree with this. Had a friend tell me the same thing. "Don't play till you have 300+ normal wins." Took his advice, got placed in S3 and got G5 in my first season. While the friends I told the same thing who didn't listen got placed bronze and admittedly regretted not taking my advice (and was stuck for a long time).

Of course everyone learns differently but: would you rather practice, get better, and be put with slightly better teammates or not practice, tank your own MMR, and have to try to climb with 4 teammates who aren't on the same level as you by the time you actually do learn?
You're talking like people that already play ranked know how to play lol

This thread is wrong on all levels, but I am not surprised it gets upvoted.
In doubt, the thread creator will talk bullshit about "it's just sarcasm".

But fine.

1) The league system is there to exactly deal with that problem.
People think they are challenger level and see it like:
(BRONZE)<------>(CHALLENGER)
And they are somewhere at Silver 5. So they think they are at 10~15% of their goal/possible skills.

If they accept they are more:
(BRONZE)<------>(GOLD)
They would realize with Silver, they are exactly in the middle of their actual skill.

And this happens no matter what level, the normal game MMR also works this way.
But that does *not* mean you are not supposed to play ranked. That's like saying the local soccer club is crying all day rivers of tears because they "just" won agains the neighbour village's soccer team and not against Madrid or Brazil (hehe, 7-1... Whatever!). 
Or that every fifth league race driver is not driving for MERCEDES next to Hamilton.



2)
Do not play Normals. Go to Ranked and leave normals alone. People who desire to play ranked are usual toxic assholes that  need to be put where they are supposed to be: Amonst other ranked players.

Or. . . 

Play yi, farm farm farm until level 11, and know what "R" and "Q" do.  Don't fight anyone, ever, until you see someone with about 20% health.  Then ks, ks, ks for the win!

OR. . . 

Play a nice solid support champ, like maybe Sona or Braum, and tell your bot lane you are just starting out in ranked.  They will promptly all-in for no reason at all, die a horrible death, and blame you.  In short, you will be JUST LIKE EVERY AUTOFILL SUPPORT IN EVERY GAME, EVER.

Don't sweat it.
I love autofill supports, Mainly because I play support :)

I'm pretty sure that there are plenty fresh lvl 30 players who are easily silver/gold+ so why wouldn't they just start ranking? There are still people worse than them and getting a bad rank early doesn't matter that much. 
Also, what's up with that "you're bad" sentiment. You've been silver despite playing for 3 years so you aren't exactly the one who should tell people to get gud.

So how good are you required to be before you play ranked? Should we make it so that no one should play ranked until they're diamond tier? Being "bad" doesn't bar you from playing ranked. That's what bronze is for.
